text: Termination of programs An important property of programs is they always terminate. How can we express it formally by using the semantics? Definition (for big-step semantics) The execution of a statement S € Stm from state s € States terminates in the big-step semantics, if there exists (S,s) > s « S loops forever on s, if (S,5) » ; « S always terminates, if S terminates on all states s € States; « S always loops, if S loops forever on all states s € States.
